alert.note: Alert for Limestone (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 6:26PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Jackson, Madison, southeastern Limestone and northern Morgan Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 625 PM CDT, the public reported a strong thunderstorm near Decatur, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40-50 mph and pea size hail. The wind gusts may be ahead of the rain so do not wait for rain to seek shelter. SOURCE...CoCoRaHS spotter reported pea size hail in Moulton, AL. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Triana and Huntsville International Airport around 635 PM CDT. Madison and Marshall Space Flight Center around 645 PM CDT. Redstone Arsenal and University Of Alabama In Huntsville around 650 PM CDT. Alabama A And M University around 655 PM CDT. Gurley around 710 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Paint Rock, Maysville, Belle Mina, French Mill, Farley, Mooresville, Capshaw, Garth, Ryland and Hampton Cove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for north central Alabama.
